abstract: Chesapeake Energy, the oil and natural gas producer, says its co-founder and chief executive, Aubrey K. McClendon, will retire on April 1, almost eight months after investors complained about a compensation plan.
snippet: Chesapeake Energy, the oil and natural gas producer, says its co-founder and chief executive, Aubrey K. McClendon, will retire on April 1, almost eight months after investors complained about a compensation plan.

headline.main: Under Fire, Chesapeake Co-Founder to Depart
headline.print_headline: Under Fire, Chesapeake Co-Founder Is to Depart

byline.original: By Clifford Krauss and Michael J. de la Merced
